question: This country granted a 3 month reprieve by the Financial Action Task Force to be placed on a terror-financing watch-list.
explanation: Pakistan has been granted a 3 month reprieve by the Financial Action Task Force to be placed on a terror-financing watch-list. The reprieve comes a week after Pak amended its anti-terror laws to ban groups listed as terrorists by the United Nations. Pakistan had been on the FATF watchlist for years but was removed in 2015 following "significant progress" in meeting the demands of the group.
